thread.title: Risers & Fallers: Global Market Group blur Group Eden Research Connemara Mining and more...
thread.title_full: Risers & Fallers: Global Market Group blur Group Eden Research Connemara Mining and more... | MENAFN.COM

author: ProactiveInvestors  UK
title: Risers & Fallers: Global Market Group blur Group Eden Research Connemara Mining and more...
text: (MENAFN - ProactiveInvestors)Below are the main news-driven share price movements at 12.45pm. RISERS Global Market Group (LON:GMC) up 20%. Its subsidiary Global Markets Group Guangzhou is to raise RMB53.5mln (5.4mln) through a subscription of 1.3mln new shares at RMB40.9p per share. blur Group (LON:BLUR) up 16.7%. The Exeter-based enterprise services platform and marketplace has appointed business mentor Robert Wirszycz as a non-executive director. Sareum Holdings (LON:SAR) up 6.7%. The specialist drug-maker has been given a patent in the US and Europe for its AuroraFLT3 inhibitors.   FALLERS CentralNic (LON:CNIC) down 11.5%. The firm fell despite more than doubling profits in the first half of 2015 and confirming it was in line with management expectations as it noted is "mindful of the challenges in sustaining" its growth strategy. Eden Research (LON:EDEN) down 11.2%. The company was lower despite narrowing losses as it continues to work towards approval for its 3AEY fungicide product. Connemara Mining (LON:CON) down 7.7%. Again losses narrowed in the first half of the year as the company focuses on low cost exploration at the Inishowen Licences in Ireland.    Below are the main news-driven share price movements at 9am. RISERS Teathers Financial (LON:TEA) up 25.7%. Its technology platform will be used to power a crowd equity app being launched by Shard Capital Partners. It is Teathers' first commercial agreement and will be free to download on iTunes Google Play and Android. Mosman Oil & Gas (LON:MSMN) up 22.9%.The company has moved STEP closer to acquisition with a royalty agreement worth NZ4mln. The company recently agreed to acquire STEP - the South Taranaki Energy Project - for NZ10mln. Central Rand Gold (LON:CZA) up 8.5%. The company significantly narrowed pre-tax losses in its first half down to US1.2mln from US15.3mln after slashing costs. It added that talks are 'progressing' on the sale of its Dutch subsidiary.   FALLERS Hydrogen Group (LON:HYDG) down 25.5%. The tough oil & gas market hit the company which reported widening pre-tax losses of 1.9mln from 1.1mln in its interim results. It has also scrapped its dividend. Cost-cutting measures are expected to take effect in the second half the company said. Coal of Africa (LON:CZA) down 10.4%. Shareholders agreed to issue 183mln new shares at 5.15p per share as part of the loan and subscription agreement with Yishun Brightrise Investment PTE. It will raise around 9.4mln. North River Resources (LON:NRRP) down 9.7%.  The firm has embarked on the first of two stages of fundraising for the construction of its Namib lead-zinc project in Nambia. It is to raise US2.8mln through a placing and open offer.
